question: How much does a tattoo cost at Cuba Tattoo Studio?
answer:
Our tattoo prices vary depending on size, complexity, and time required. Small tattoos start from $80, while medium pieces range from $150 to $400. For large tattoos or full sessions, prices range from $500 to $1,500 or more.

We offer free consultations where we evaluate your design and give you an exact quote. We also have flexible payment plans for large projects.

question: Does getting a tattoo hurt?
answer:
Yes, tattoos cause some discomfort, but the pain level varies by person and body location. Areas with more fat or muscle (like arms and legs) hurt less than bony areas (ribs, ankles).

Our artists use techniques that minimize pain and guide you through the entire process. Many clients describe the sensation as continuous scratching or intense vibration.

Tips to reduce pain: Get good sleep the night before, eat before your appointment, stay hydrated, and avoid alcohol.

question: How to care for a new tattoo?
answer:
The first 2-3 days are crucial for healing. Follow these steps:

  • Keep the protective film for 2-4 hours after the tattoo
  • Wash gently with fragrance-free antibacterial soap
  • Apply healing ointment (we recommend Aquaphor or A&D) 2-3 times daily
  • Don't submerge in water (pools, bathtubs) for 2 weeks
  • Avoid direct sunlight and don't scratch

Complete healing takes 2-4 weeks. We provide detailed instructions and recommended products.

question: How long does it take to get a tattoo?
answer:
Time depends on the size and complexity of the design:

  • Small tattoos: 30 minutes to 2 hours
  • Medium tattoos: 2 to 5 hours
  • Large tattoos: 5+ hours (may require multiple sessions)

For large pieces, we divide the work into 4-6 hour sessions for your comfort. During consultation, we give you an accurate time estimate.

question: Can I bring my own design?
answer:
Absolutely! We love working with your ideas. You can bring:

  • Original designs or references
  • Photos or inspiration images
  • Sketches or drawings

Our artists will adapt your design to work perfectly as a tattoo, considering body flow, size, and technical details.

We also create completely custom designs based on your ideas during the free consultation.

question: What's the minimum age to get a tattoo?
answer:
You must be at least 18 years old to get tattooed without parental consent. For minors:

  • 16-17 years: Requires written parental/guardian consent and their presence during the appointment
  • Under 16: We do not perform tattoos

We always verify identification and strictly follow New Mexico regulations to protect minors.

question: Do you do cover-ups of old tattoos?
answer:
Yes, we're cover-up specialists! Our artists have extensive experience transforming old tattoos into new works of art.

Cover-up process:

  • Evaluation of existing tattoo
  • Strategic design to completely cover
  • Selection of appropriate colors and techniques
  • Final result that exceeds your expectations

Some very dark tattoos may require laser sessions beforehand for better results. We'll advise you on the best option.

question: What tattoo styles do you do?
answer:
Our artists master all major styles:

  • Realism: Photorealistic portraits and landscapes
  • Traditional/Old School: Classic American designs
  • Neo-Traditional: Modern evolution of traditional
  • Blackwork: Solid black designs
  • Fine Line: Delicate and minimalist lines
  • Watercolor: Watercolor effects
  • Geometric: Geometric patterns and shapes

Each artist has their unique specialties. During consultation, we connect you with the perfect artist for your style.

question: How to schedule an appointment?
answer:
Scheduling your appointment is easy:

  1. Free consultation: Call (505) 555-1234 or visit us
  2. Discuss your idea: We talk about design, placement, and budget
  3. Schedule the session: We choose a convenient date and time
  4. Deposit: $50-100 to reserve your appointment

Hours: Monday-Saturday 10am-8pm, Sunday 12pm-6pm

For large projects, we recommend scheduling 1-2 weeks in advance.

question: Are you certified and licensed?
answer:
Absolutely! Cuba Tattoo Studio meets all legal requirements:

  • New Mexico State License for commercial operation
  • Updated health certifications
  • Licensed artists with professional training
  • Regular inspections by the Health Department

We follow strict sterilization protocols and use disposable equipment. Your safety is our number one priority.

question: Can I see the artists' portfolios?
answer:
Of course! You can see our work in several ways:

  • In the studio: Physical portfolios of each artist
  • Instagram: @cubatattoostudio - we update daily
  • Website: Complete gallery organized by style
  • Personal consultation: We review specific work related to your interest

Each artist has their unique style and specialties. We help you choose the perfect artist for your vision.

question: What should I do before my tattoo appointment?
answer:
Preparation for your appointment:

  • Sleep well the night before (minimum 7 hours)
  • Eat a full meal 1-2 hours before
  • Stay hydrated but avoid alcohol 24 hours before
  • Wear comfortable clothes that allow access to the tattoo area
  • Bring valid ID and payment method
  • Arrive 15 minutes early to complete forms

Avoid: Aspirin, alcohol, drugs, recent tanning in the area.

question: Do you also do piercings?
answer:
We specialize exclusively in tattoos to provide you with the best possible service. We do not offer piercing services.

However, we can recommend professional and trusted piercing studios in Albuquerque that maintain the same quality and safety standards as we do.

Our 100% focus on tattoos allows us to perfect our art and offer the best possible experience.

question: Do you offer a guarantee on your tattoos?
answer:
Yes! We guarantee our work. We offer:

  • Free touch-ups within the first 30 days
  • Free corrections if there are normal healing issues
  • Post-tattoo advice throughout the healing process

Important: The guarantee applies only if you follow our care instructions. Touch-ups due to care negligence have additional cost.

Our commitment is that you leave 100% satisfied with your new artwork.
